prototypes.prototype: DTOC Function Formatted_Date as C = DTOC(D date[,C date_format[,L localized]])
Formatted_Date as C = DTOC( Date_Time as T [, Format as C ] )

argument.name: Formatted_Date
argument.description: The Date_Value formatted into a character string.

argument.name: date
argument.description: A variable containing a date value or a character string containing a legitimate representation of a date value ( ISDATE (Date_Value) = .T.).

argument.name: Date_Time
argument.description: A variable containing a date time value.

argument.name: date_format
argument.description: Optional. Default = "MM/DD/YYYY". Refer to Predefined Date Formats.

argument.name: localized
argument.description: Logical. Converts a date into a character value in the form 'MM/DD/YYYY'.

page.discussions: The first argument to the time function does the formatting. The optional second argument sets the value.
